alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 11:43AM EDT until May 01 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Presumpscot River At West Falmouth affecting Cumberland County. For the Presumpscot River...including West Falmouth...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Presumpscot River at West Falmouth. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, River comes out of its banks and floods portions of Fraser Field. High flows make recreational activities hazardous. At 14.0 feet, Water approaches the backyards of properties along Water Street in Westbrook and Riverside Street in Portland. At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding affects storage yards of industrial businesses on Warren Avenue in Westbrook. Property should be relocated to places which are 5 feet higher than nearby river banks to avoid being flooded or isolated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EDT Monday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM EDT Monday was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 14.7 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon to 7.6 feet Wednesday morning. It will rise to 7.7 feet Wednesday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
